result.execSummary:
The defendant Martez Devon Anthony was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court applies balance of jail credit after good time credit (9 days at $100 a day) in lieu of court costs and DNA surcharge. PAID IN FULL.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

defendant.name: Anthony, Martez Devon

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Martez Devon Anthony in court, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas Martinez in court for Martez Devon Anthony. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #1. Court conducts colloquy with the Defendant and finds them guilty of count #1. 

State makes sentencing arguments. Defense makes sentencing arguments Defendant makes statements. 

Court orders the following:	
37  Days in the Waukesha County Jail
37 Days Credit with good time credit applied as well. TIME SERVED SENTENCE. 
 
Costs:  $243.00
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Court applies balance of jail credit after good time credit, 9 days, at $100 a day, toward costs.

Letter dated 10/07/2022, filed by Atty Martinez, request for Plea/Sentencing

**Reviewed by Judge Carter on 10/07/2022 - Okay to convert 10/17 to Plea/Sentencing Hearing.**
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
